intro: Isoplexis canariensis f. glaberrima, commonly known as the Canary Island isoplexis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Loganiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is native to the Canary Islands and thrives in coastal and rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
